steps.content: Late bottled vintage This term is typically used to describe a unique type of port wine with a distinctive taste. Traditional vintage port is aged for 2 years, then bottled and aged further. By comparison, late bottled vintage (LVBS) port is released 4 to 6 years after the vintage and ready to drink immediately after being bottled.
